Class I18N

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.I18N
public class I18N extends Object
Convenience class to handle I18N messages.
Author:
P.W. Wong, AHMCT, Michael Darter, Douglas Lau

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(Properties props)
      Read resource bundle and assign to public static field. This method should be called once at program startup.
      Parameters:
      props - Opened property file which contains the language, country, and variant.

    • getSilent

      public static String getSilent(String id)
      Get the specified message, with no error messages returned if there is an error.
      Parameters:
      id - Name of I18N string in the bundle.
      Returns:
      The I18N string cooresponding to id, else null on error

    • get

      public static String get(String id)
      Get the specified message.
      Parameters:
      id - Name of I18N string in the bundle.
      Returns:
      The I18N string cooresponding to id, else error message

    • format

      public static String format(String id, Object... args)
      Get the specified message and format it.
      Parameters:
      id - Name of I18N string in the bundle.
      args - Arguments for format string.
      Returns:
      The I18N string cooresponding to id, else error message

    • getKeyEvent

      public static int getKeyEvent(String id)
      Return the implied key mnemonic in the specified I18N string. For example, if the I18N string is <html><u>B</u>lank</html> then VK_B is returned.
      Parameters:
      id - Name of I18N string in the bundle.
      Returns:
      The KeyEvent code else 0 on failure.
      See Also:
      • KeyEvent

    • getKeyEventChar

      public static char getKeyEventChar(String id)
      Return the implied key mnemonic in the specified I18N string as a character. For example, if the I18N string is <html><u>B</u>lank</html> then 'B' is returned.
      Parameters:
      id - Name of I18N string in the bundle.
      Returns:
      The 1st underlined char else '\0' on failure.

    • extractUnderline

      public static String extractUnderline(String xml)
      Extract underlined text from the argument.
      Returns:
      Null on failure or if no underline text exists, else the underlined text, which might have length 0.
